subject: Critical Thinking
title: Inoculation Theory: Vaccinating Minds Against Manipulation
description: A 60-second lesson on Inoculation Theory: Vaccinating Minds Against Manipulation.

hook.text: Expose people to weak versions of misinformation techniques, & they become resistant to the real thing.

buildup.text: Inoculation theory: like a biological vaccine, a 'weakened dose' of manipulation builds mental antibodies.

discovery.text: Cambridge researchers created a game where players create fake news. After playing, they were 21% better at spotting it.

twist.text: Teaching people ABOUT manipulation techniques works better than fact-checking individual claims. Process beats content.

climax.text: Prebunking is more effective than debunking. Prevention beats cure.

punchline.text: The best defense against manipulation: learn how it works before it finds you.

quiz.question: Why is prebunking more effective than debunking?
options: It builds resistance before exposure, while debunking tries to undo damage after
